meanings.definition: The act of playing and mixing recorded music for an audience.
meanings.sent1: At the party, the deejaying kept everyone dancing all night.
meanings.sent2: She learned deejaying by practicing with different songs and beats.
meanings.sent3: The deejaying at the wedding made even the shyest guests get up and groove.
meanings.sent4: His deejaying was like painting a colorful musical picture for the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The deejaying filled the room with energy and excitement.

meanings.definition: The skill or profession of a disc jockey.
meanings.sent1: His deejaying skills impressed the club owner and got him a regular gig.
meanings.sent2: She studied deejaying techniques to improve her performance on the radio.
meanings.sent3: The deejaying job required him to stay up late but he loved every moment of it.
meanings.sent4: Her deejaying profession allowed her to share her love for music with others.
meanings.sent5: The art of deejaying requires a good ear for music and a passion for entertaining.
